intro: Croton cascarilla, commonly known as Spanish cedar or cedro de España, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties.
